revised_title: George Frederick Charles Searle: A Life in Physics and Education
tldr: George Frederick Charles Searle was a prominent British physicist and educator, born in 1864. He conducted research on electromagnetism and contributed to the development of magnetic properties testing methods. Searle also played a significant role in shaping the teaching of experimental physics at the Cavendish Laboratory, Cambridge, where he influenced generations of students, including several Nobel laureates.
